attributes.action: Suspend the 12 billion spent on overseas aid for cancer treatment and research.
attributes.background: One in two people are now affected by cancer. Since 2010 six of my relatives/ friends have died from cancer. Eight people I know currently have cancer, two with terminal cancer. A close relative is one of the two.
attributes.additional_details: The U.K. gives 12 billion pounds a year (0.7% GNI - source BBC - 2015) in overseas aid. I am not suggesting that this is stopped, only that as cancer is now so prevalent in our country ( one in two people are now affected - my husband's consultant quoted this) that temporarily this money is used to help the people in need in this country. Walk down the main corridor at The Christie (cancer specialist hospital) in Manchester at 9.00 am on any weekday to see how many people have this illness, and this is only one example of a hospital in the UK.

attributes.action: Make First Aid Training compulsory in Schools, Colleges and new drivers
attributes.background: We should follow other European countries and make first aid training compulsory at various levels in schools and colleges and First training be compulsory for new drivers
attributes.additional_details: Sweden, Norway , Germany all deliver first aid at school age and for new drivers

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a hound used in a drag hunt to participate without a muzzle
attributes.background: Mistakes occur in drag hunts to often, wild mammals, mainly hares and foxes are still being mutilated, injured or killed by hunting hounds, this generaly occurs when the pack go off the trail and catch the real scent of a wild animal instead of the artifical scent which is used when drag hunting
attributes.additional_details:
In 2004 the Hunting Act was passed which bans the hunting of wild animals with dogs in England and Wales, the act does not affect drag hunting (when hounds are trained to follow an artifical scent). 
Passing a law which requires hounds being used for drag hunting to be muzzled or persons involved to be prosecuted will lead to clearer intentification of illegal hunts making prosecution easier. www.facebook.com/KeepTheFoxHuntBan/
This site shows various video and photo documenations.

attributes.action: Allow life Imprisonment for cat killers
attributes.background:
People are not scared to kill cats or other animals, as is shown with the Croydon cat killer, he has slaughtered hundreds of cats. However, the maximum sentence for killing a cat is 6 months imprisonment. 
This will not deter awful criminals from ending a poor cat's life.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/664265/Croydon-cat-killer-jailed-weeks-campaigners-call-for-tougher-sentencing-animal-cruelty 
Animal abusers are locked up for just weeks before coming out and killing again.

attributes.action: Give Special Constables who complete over 200 hours a year a tax incentive
attributes.background: Special Constables provide vital support to front line policing, giving up their free time, often days away from family, and even using leave from work to perform duties. Though no Special Constables do this for financial reward, all duties are performed voluntarily, often risking their own safety.
attributes.additional_details: Special Constables are expected to perform a minimum of 16 hours a month, yet most Special Constables go above and beyond, some completing upwards of 60 hours a month. One East Midlands force had Special Constables perform over 60,000 hours of duty in 2015, 59% of which were spent on frontline policing duties, responding to 999 calls and life or death situations. The rest carried out where either on local policing initiatives, community safety and training.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to cause injury to a ridden horse on a public road.
attributes.background: Due to an ever increasing number of serious accidents reported on UK roads involving horses, we feel that further care needs to be taken by other road users. The fact that there is no penalty for causing injury to horses by driving dangerously does not encourage drivers to use proper care.

attributes.action: Protection to leaseholders/residents to avoid exploitation from Property Mgt Co.
attributes.background: Many Property management companies exploit their position by charging excessive fees whilst providing a very poor service. They hide behind a 91 year old law to justify their actions when in reality they are just taking advantage of the situation to make more profit for the company.
attributes.additional_details: Service charges go up every year without any improvements to the estate. Deficit charges are regularly added onto accounts because of poor budgeting. Expensive Insurance policy's and contracts are taken out and charged back to the leaseholders when they are available a lot cheaper elsewhere. Many leaseholders would like 'the right to manage' themselves but this can be a long winded process which can put many off.

attributes.action: Make the North East Combined Authority give the people a vote on Devolution
attributes.background:
SUNDERLAND COUNCIL LEADER PAUL WATSON HAS TOLD THE NEWCASTLE CHRONICLE WE THE PUBLIC DON’T WANT A VOTE ON DEVOLUTION 
HE SEEMS TO HAVE FORGOTTEN WE HAVE ALREADY VOTED ON DEVOLUTION IN 2004 AND IT WAS A MASSIVE MAJORITY TO REJECT DEVOLUTION

attributes.action: Stop Local Council bosses earning six figure salaries.
attributes.background: After doing some research I have discovered that many council bosses/staff earn as much as £215,000! Local councils are apparently cash strapped and residents are being asked to pay more. This needs to be stopped. They should not be paid any more than an MP.
attributes.additional_details: People should use search engines to see how much people are paid in their local council.

attributes.action: For Corby to have their own hospital.
attributes.background: We have the urgent care centre in Corby, also known as 8-8. Who claim to have the resources of a hospital like KGH, but they do not. They lack observing sick patients. Mainly young children, to the point where they don't carry out the right tests to determine if that patient is really sick.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I have is my own son, who may I quote is only 1 in a few days. I recently took him to the urgent care centre on the 5/12/16, because his lack of breathing and chesty cough. I was sat there for four hours to only be told he's fine and his chest is clear. He had no observations done. The next day my son was rushed to hospital and I was told he was lacking oxygen really bad (65 out of 100 to be persist) he then had to have 5ml of steroids (oral) 8-8 failed my little boy.

attributes.action: Do not invite Donald Trump to address a joint session of Parliament.
attributes.background: The president-elect of the USA has offended many people and groups in the course of his election campaign.  He should be condemned for his racism and sexism.  Many historians have expressed alarm at his fascist tendencies.  He does not deserve the honour of a visit to our symbol of democracy.
attributes.additional_details: All balanced news coverage of the US election campaign from mid-2015 onwards provides a continuous stream of the offensive language and dangerous policies of president-elect Trump.

attributes.action: Support for sliding scale payments to 1950s women instead of total pension loss.
attributes.background: Delayed pension payments to women born in 1950s seems unnecessarily harsh with little or no redress or power to have a say in this decision.
attributes.additional_details: At 60 I work freelance p/t occasionally. This is enough work for me (everyone is different) but I am sure 60 year + women would not want to work full time if the main reason is to support a changed government policy.   It would be sensible to have a sliding scale of pension rather than absolutely nothing causing hardship during the years 1950's women have to wait to receive their pension - that they have rightly paid into all their working lives and will now lose up to £30k per women.

attributes.action: Make 12 November 2018 a Bank Holiday to commemorate 100 yrs since the Great War.
attributes.background: Over 1.1 million Service men and women lost their lives in the Great War. We invite you to create a dedication to each and every one of them and celebrate what they achieved. This day will be devoted to the remembrance of the fallen and to support charities across the UK dedicated to this cause.

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide carbon tax applying to both citizens and corporations.
attributes.background: This petition is a call for politicians to take action against the threat of climate change before it is too late. We are calling for nationwide taxation on all activities and products contributing to the emission of carbon dioxide, which would set our country on the path to a sustainable future.

attributes.action:
Provide CCTV in all Care homes (
Special Needs, Disabled, Dementia, Elderly)
attributes.background: I am a single mum with a son who has autism and should he live in a care home, when i am no longer around, I want him to be protected and all his care to be recorded in case of negligence or abuse.

attributes.action: Every private members bill allotted a debate is guaranteed to be put to a vote
attributes.background: The filibustering associated with the Turing Bill was an example of too much power concentrated in the hands of a few ministers. Any MP should be able to put bills before parliament, have them debated and voted upon. We need a proper constitution but this would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Keep the army bound by the European Convention on Human Rights during conflict.
attributes.background: In her conference speech, Theresa May declared that the army would have an opt-out of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) during conflict. This means, in effect, that the army would have a free hand to violate basic human rights such as freedom from torture and the right to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details: The ECHR is an international treaty, drafted in 1950 and championed by British governments ever since. It sets out a series of fundamental rights that governments are bound to respect. This Convention was signed and ratified by the British government in the aftermath of the WWII to ensure that the human rights violations during this conflict would not happen again. For more information on the rights that the ECHR protects, visit: www.echr.coe.int/Documents/Convention_ENG.pdf

attributes.action: Invest more money into scientific research to find the cause of M.E / CFS
attributes.background: M.E./CFS is a debilitating autoimmune disease currently affecting 250,000 people in the UK. Many sufferers are unable to work or care for themselves, and 25% of M.E. patients are bedbound. Most M.E. sufferers are on ESA or disability benefits, causing a significant economic burden.
attributes.additional_details: No universally effective treatment exists for M.E. Current NHS treatments for the illness are based on the controversial PACE trial, and have been found ineffective or even harmful. Good quality research into the root cause of the illness is needed. The current annual budget for biomedical research works at roughly £1 per patient per year. We want the budget for research to be dramatically increased. We also ask for the formation of a work group focussing on the issues surrounding this disease.

attributes.action: Legalize Cannabis Oil and use it in the NHS to help people suffering from Cancer
attributes.background: Cannabis Oil itself is able to cure Cancer and there is enough evidence and research to prove so. if this was legalized and put into the NHS,the amount of patients suffering from cancer would decrease and would effectively save people from Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
also, the reason that cannabis oil (from cannabis) is not used to cure and kill cancer because it is a plant, and cannot be patented, which means pharmaceutical companies cannot make profit off it.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/government-finally-admits-cannabis-kills-6303176

https://www.cancertutor.com/index8/

http://www.cureyourowncancer.org/how-cannabis-oil-works.html

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents not to vaccinate a child
attributes.background:
Not vaccinating your children makes two things more likely
- Your child will get sick
- Your child will spread that illness to other unprotected children, some of whom may be too young to have received the necessary vaccination.
Therefore, not getting your child vaccinated is grossly negligent.
attributes.additional_details: Herd immunity is the primary reason for mass immunisation - in layman's terms, it means that the more people are immunised against a given disease, the less that disease will be able to spread, and more people (especially children too young to receive that specific vaccination) will be safe from it. We call on the government to criminalise non-vaccinating parents who refuse an initial order to vaccinate.

attributes.action: Keep abortions free on the NHS.
attributes.background:
There is a petition stating that the NHS should not pay for abortions, and I was shocked and appalled by this stance. 

Being pro-choice is the understanding that each person deserves full body autonomy and no religious, governmental, or personal opinion should impact that freedom for individuals.
attributes.additional_details:
I wanted to ensure that if the previously mentioned petition garners enough signatures to be discussed in Parliament, that there is also a petition which directly contradicts it, that can be discussed simultaneously. 

If you believe women should have the right to choice; to choose if they carry a child, and this choice should be given freely & safely by trained medical professionals, with aftercare and access to additional support with no charge, please sign this petition!

attributes.action: Respond to US Executive Order banning people from Muslim countries entering USA
attributes.background: Until the order is revoked, UK must pledge: To call on US govt to reverse the ban; No US-UK government visits; No talks on US-UK trade & migration; Full legal support to UK citizens & businesses affected; To welcome refugees refused entry to USA; To stand up for religious freedom and human rights
attributes.additional_details: On 27 January 2017, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order putting in place a 90-day block on entry to the US from citizens from Iran, Iraq, Syria, Yemen, Sudan, Libya and Somalia. The ban applies to those already settled in the US as well as those travelling there, and people in transit (including at least 1 child) have been detained at airports on the US border within 24 hours of signature. UK citizens are also covered by the ban if they are connected with one of these countries.

attributes.action: Abolish old & outdated leasehold law for all leasehold flats. Make them freehold
attributes.background: Crooked & unregulated freeholders hold leaseholders to ransom with high fees. When we buy a flat, we should also own a section of the outside part of the building and parts of the communal area. Responsibility should lie with the flat owner, not the freeholder. Commonhold law may be required here.
attributes.additional_details: The freeholder of the building should be forced to sell part of their freehold (for a cheap price) at the start and then eventually force them to give up the freehold. Leaseholders in UK are being conned and ripped off by unregulated freeholders.

attributes.action: Eliminate the state pension & benefits to pay for the costs of brexit
attributes.background: It is unfair for the costs of exiting the EU and any financial risk to our economy to be paid for by the young & employed.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of setting up & running the Department of Exiting the EU & any subsequent downturn in the economy should be paid for by eliminating the state pension, job seekers allowance, pension credit etc. Any future downturn in government tax receipts due to recession should be paid for by eliminating these programs before increasing VAT or pay roll taxes.

attributes.action: Guarantee rights of UK Nationals resident in other EU states will not change.
attributes.background: As a matter of urgency we call upon the UK government to unambiguously commit to guarantee any ‘Brexit deal’ will ensure all rights currently enjoyed by UK nationals resident in other EU states prior to the triggering of article 50 will remain unchanged.
attributes.additional_details: According to UN estimates 1.2 million UK Citizens have exercised their right as EU citizens to move permanently to other EU states. In many cases, if not most, entire lives are now in adoptive countries. Businesses have been opened, property has been purchased, children have been enrolled in local schools. Many such individuals were denied a voice in the Brexit vote due residency status abroad and / or errors of the electoral committee.

attributes.action: Replace all Benefits with a Universal Guaranteed Minimum Income
attributes.background: Guaranteed minimum income means the provision of identical payments from a government to all of its citizens, that is unconditionally granted to all on an individual basis, without means test or work requirement.
attributes.additional_details:
A basic income will provide a more substantial safety net for all people. and will contribute to less working hours, better working conditions and a better distribution of jobs. 

It is a means for sharing out the wealth produced by a society to all people. 

It can help people do other work and reconsider old choices.

It rewards unpaid contributions to society that our economy increasingly relies on. 

And is a way to redistribute the advantages of on-going technological advancement.

attributes.action: Reduce aid budget and fully fund an integrated health and social care service.
attributes.background: Our health and social care system is fragmented and in crisis.  The NHS is financially bankrupt and being kept afloat artificially.  The funding to UN Aid Budgets and other ill thought out financial aid initiatives should stop and that money diverted to the NHS and social care

attributes.action: Introduce preferential voting to UK general and local elections.
attributes.background: Preferential voting is a voting system that allows voters to rank their choices of candidate in order of preference (see: "instant-runoff voting" in Australia). Such a system is very helpful in preventing the so-called "two-horse race" issue that is common in first-past-the-post voting systems.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's voting system is known as a "first-past-the-post" system. It means that one can only vote for a single candidate, and, as has been the case in recent elections at home and abroad, this means that one is unable to vote for their interests as any vote for a third party is wasted, and may even serve to split the vote and see an unpopular candidate win. Preferential voting allows one to vote as they wish, rather than being forced to vote strategically against their least-favoured candidate.

attributes.action: Move Houses of Parliament to the North of England
attributes.background: Government is considering a multi billion pound refurbishment of the Houses of Parliament. It would seem that now would be an ideal opportunity to relocate from this outdated building and move to a more central location within the UK, near Manchester for example.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit, the development of HS2, the northern powerhouse and other regional investments, a massive project like re-locating the seat of our democracy to the regions would create huge opportunities. Business and industry often follow politics and one would hope that the same could be said if the Houses of Parliament were to re-locate to any of the regions.

attributes.action: Allow current/new students to have free text books for university courses
attributes.background: It is only fair that current/new students get the fulfilment of their university course they pay for (£9,000 a year), by providing free set text books for each course they are on.
attributes.additional_details: With the decision made by the Government for tuition fees to rise further to £9,250 in the academic year of 2017, it is plausible for Parliament to enforce this.

attributes.action: Require the Department of Health to review outdated (1988) Child Growth Chart
attributes.background: Infants and Children's weight in the UK is measured on an outdated growth chart formulated in 1988 based on formula fed babies and children in 1988. This is wrongly leading to children and babies being "labelled" as obese from birth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for this petition as today my health visitor advised me that my child who was born just above the 75th centile for weight and above the 98th centile for height is "overweight".  (Despite being breastfed on demand for 16 months of his life, as per best advice to breastfeed for the first year.)
Despite this the Health Visitor tells me that at any contact with a health professional we are likely to be advised about regulating his weight.

attributes.action: Bring back the Death Penalty for Murder, Rape and Child Molestation
attributes.background: With the growing murder and rape pandemic, it is necessary to have a deterrent.  Too long the government and judges have trivialised murder, rape and child molestation with poor sentences. The victims have been ignored by many judges and politicians are too quick back the criminals
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the death sentence the nominal must be over the age of 18 and for the that person to have proven beyond all reasonable doubt to have committed the offence of murder, rape or child molestation.   The sentence should be the same regardless of ethnic background or gender and should be law that applies to all people in our country.  The victims are so twice. Firstly, by the perpetrator and and again by the judicial system with the weak sentences they give.  This has to stop.

attributes.action: Stop paying non uk citizens any benifits
attributes.background: If we stop paying benifits. Some migrants will leave of there own accord. Some might stop trying to come to the UK

attributes.action: All businesses to have disabled access including a ramp and moving space inside.
attributes.background: A lot of small businesses don't have disabled access, preventing people (like my mother who was diagnosed with rheumatoid and osteoarthritis a few years back) entering shops. Some that do have a ramp to allow the disabled into the store don't have enough space to allow navigation around the store.
attributes.additional_details: Please help make it illegal for shops to not have disabled access (a ramp and enough space inside) as this prevents people, like my mother, entering shops whatsoever.

attributes.action: Abolish road tax increase until road conditions are improved
attributes.background: Action should be taken as we are currently paying road tax, which is set to increase in the near future, when the condition of roads is appalling. So why increase it? What do we currently pay road tax for and where is our money going?

attributes.action: STOP the closure of Rotherham main post office
attributes.background:
Rotherham as you know has had bad press,
For the people of  our town many things have disappeared that once made this town a good place to live, buildings pulled down without consulting the people, 
now the main Rotherham post office  (3-5 Bridgegate) is next to be hit,
please put a stop to this.
attributes.additional_details:
this post office is a necessity for the people of Rotherham.
a lot of people including the elderly  use this post office and in turn helps local trade as some have it as part of a day in the town center. it is necessary for passports, driving licenses, pensions ect ect, Rotherham as a town is slowly disappearing and it needs to be stopped, a once proud people are now seeing Rotherham town center disappear, contrary to popular belief not everyone has the internet and still need this post office

attributes.action: Factor wealth and assets outside of salary into CMS calculation & remove cap.
attributes.background:
Legal loophole allows wealthy fathers to pay nothing for their children;
The CMS doesn't look at assets or wealth outside of salary therefore individuals paid via dividends/international income streams are outside of its jurisdiction. Salary above £156k not factored in, disadvantaging children.
attributes.additional_details:
Schedule 1 of the Children's Act used to provide an alternative assessment pathway but mothers questing for justice are at the mercy of UK law; things have gone from bad to worse since a case led to Judges not applying Schedule 1 of the Children's Act until a tribunal hearing via the CMS has been reached and won; seemingly impossible to do when the CMS don't look at wealth outside of salary. 
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143067
http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed143343

attributes.action: Subsidise Care Fees for the elderly by using money from  Overseas Aid.
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to sell their homes to fund their care when billions are spent, much of it wasted, on foreign aid.  Surely we should look after our own first, before borrowing money to spend on foreigners.

attributes.action: Impose economic sanctions on the USA if they renege on the Paris Climate deal
attributes.background: Climate change is an immediate threat to global ecosystems, livelihoods and communities. The Paris climate agreement is international law and must be fulfilled in order to mitigate dangerous warming. We call for economic sanctions on the USA if they withdraw from the agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change will rapidly escalate within decades unless urgent action is taken. The USA contribute 16% of global CO2 emissions and must play a leading role in fulfilling the Paris agreement. If the USA withdraw this could lead to catastrophic consequences, with the poorest people in the world suffering the most. If they withdraw, the UK should impose economic sanctions on the USA and encourage its allies to do likewise. 
www.newscientist.com/article/2112164-president-trump-means-we-cant-escape-a-dangerously-warmer-world/ www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition 
www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Guarantee PIP for all people diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: If you are officially diagnosed with ASD/Autism by a GP or a health care professional such as a psychologist, psychiatrist or a multidisciplinary team, then a PIP assessment to prove your illness should not be needed. It should be recognised upon application when you provide written diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details: ASD/Autism is a life long condition and should automatically qualify for PIP. The assessment is nothing more than unnecessary bureaucracy that usually ends in refusal for PIP. I would also like to make the RT Hon Damian Green MP aware that the assessors that carry out these assessments do take advantage of an autistic person's disability to ensure they dont score any points in the assessment and refuse them PIP. If the RT Hon Damian Green would like more detail I am available to talk about it.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: Make schools relax their uniform policies
attributes.background: Schools are turning pupils away due to uniform violations which disrupts a child's education. Schools should be made to relax these draconian policies. A parent is fined for taking their child out in term time, yet schools openly send children home. Clothing does not have a bearing on education!
attributes.additional_details:
Why do schools think it's ok to disrupt a child's education in this way? This denies children the education they are entitled to. The strict uniform policies are often discriminatory and unfair, if not petty.
School uniforms are a part of school life, this is accepted, but why does the 'wrong colour' black shoe or wrong type of material matter?  A child's education should matter more than the cut of their clothing. Make schools relax their policies to ensure all children are treated fairly!

attributes.action: Stop all DWP benefit payment sanctions immediately.
attributes.background:
It is basically unethical and unhealthy.
The UN agree - It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in B
attributes.additional_details:
THE United Nations committee on economic and cultural rights recently published a highly damning report.
It confirmed that the British government’s austerity measures are indeed in breach of its obligations to the human rights of citizens living in Britain.
The report considers a number of areas, all of which are drastically important to our everyday lives. . . . 
 foodbanks, unemployment rates, the housing crisis, mental health care and discrimination against migrants and disabled people.

attributes.action: Regulate vehicle techs to only allow qualified  people to repair motor vehicles
attributes.background: Currently any person can repair  their own or anyone else's vehicle with no training or experience of motor  vehicles. Eg replace their brake with disastrous or fatal results. Other trades are regulated to stop untrained people  from carrying out dangerous  repair work  Eg gas fitters and elections
attributes.additional_details:
Other concerns  are electric  cars
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/life-style/motoring/motoring-news/electric-cars-mechanics-with-no-specialist-training-risk-death-when-tinkering-with-the-vehicles-a6816786.html%3famp
13% of road accidents are cause by mechanical failure or poorly service vehicles. Regulation  would cut accidents and possibly save lives

attributes.action: Lift Pitbull Type of Dogs Ban
attributes.background: Many people in the UK and I believe that pitbulls shouldn't be illegal. They are the most misunderstood breed of dog, all dogs can be trained to be aggressive. It is the owners actions if the dog is violent or not. Pitbulls and Staffies are the best family dogs to own.
attributes.additional_details: Pitbulls are own for having a bad reputation due to the owners faults. If any dog is violent they should be kept on the lead and muzzled. Pitbulls are statistically the most friendliest of dogs to other dogs and humans. And find it very difficult to be alone. http://dogtime.com/dog-breeds/american-pit-bull-terrier#/slide/1 If Pitbulls are only given to good owners, then none of the Pitbulls will be aggressive to others. I have owned staffies my whole life and they couldn't hurt a fly.

attributes.action: Allow 16/17 year olds to vote.
attributes.background: In Year 9 in secondary school we are made to choose our GCSE subjects, at 16 we can smoke, win the lottery have sex, get a job. At 17 you can drive and you start choosing your University/life root and yet we cannot vote until we're 18. WE as a generation are one of the most educated ever. FIX IT.

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for child rape
attributes.background: A child who is raped has the rest of their life to face in ruins and turmoil due to what has happend to them. So why do we have such light sentences for it. With this crime increasing daily it should now have the sentence of life in prison to help prevent this awful act.

attributes.action: PLEASE GIVE RIGHT OF APPEAL TO TIER 1 ENTREPRENEUR INITIAL & EXTENSION VISA
attributes.background: Our request to all Honourable UK Parliament members is that please restore the right of appeal for Tier 1 entrepreneur applicants if refused due to errors, Appeal right defend the applicants and allow them to provide solid evidence against the raised issues
attributes.additional_details: Applicants can apply for an administrative review of the Tier 1 entrepreneur refusal decision if they think that Home Office has made an error in considering their application.When they apply for administrative review, no evidence is allowed to forward in favour of the refused application. This means that if Home Office maintained the refused decision then they order applicants to leave the country ASAP and they could lose their running business and investment that could ruin their future

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Ban all schools from using mini buses.
attributes.background:
Schools drive pupils/students around in mini buses on basic car licences.
Ban all schools from doing this unless they employ a qualified PCV licence holder with up to date CPC card.
attributes.additional_details:
If schools had to use coach companies it would create jobs and boost business.
All drivers are qualified and CRB checked so children would be safe still.
